# MIDIBluetoothDriverActivateAllConnections()

**Function**

Promote all active Bluetooth connections into an online MIDI device capable of input and output.

## Declaration

```swift
func MIDIBluetoothDriverActivateAllConnections() -> OSStatus
```

## Return Value

A status code that indicates the result of the activation.

## Discussion

To establish a Bluetooth MIDI driver connection to a Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) MIDI peripheral, perform the following steps:

1. Scan for the peripheral’s advertised BLE MIDI service by using [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/CoreBluetooth].
2. Connect to the advertised peripheral by using [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/CoreBluetooth].
3. Call [doc://com.apple.coremidi/documentation/CoreMIDI/MIDIBluetoothDriverActivateAllConnections()] upon successful connection.
4. Confirm the peripheral’s registration by using [doc://com.apple.coremidi/documentation/CoreMIDI] and inspecting [doc://com.apple.coremidi/documentation/CoreMIDI/MIDIDeviceRef].

If the device reference is present, [doc://com.apple.coremidi/documentation/CoreMIDI] owns a connection to the peripheral, so use [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/CoreBluetooth] to disconnect from the peripheral.

## Managing Device Connections

- **MIDIBluetoothDriverDisconnect(_:)**: Disconnect the Bluetooth MIDI driver from a Bluetooth Low Energy MIDI peripheral.
